page.title: 09Religion: St. Erth Church
page.content: The Church Nothing is known of the first Church of St.Erth, or of others which may have succeeded it until the present Church was originally built in the l4th or l5th centuries. The present Nave has some early Perpendicular work, with the Chancel a little earlier in the Transitional period. The Tower, which is without buttresses, is l4th century. The difficulty of dating the Church with accuracy arises from the extensive restoration and rebuilding carried out. Vicar Collins, in l747, showing great zeal in his removals and repairs, and even more extensive re-building was instigated by Vicar Mills in l873.
